result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik M Ayala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik M Ayala

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant plead No Contest. Court found the defendant guilty. Court ordered defendant to pay a civil forfeiture in the amount of $100.00 including all court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid by 4/25/2016 or a civil judgment will be entered.

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted. Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Milwaukee County Ordinance Sec. 63.01, a Civil Forfeiture.

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted. Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. First call- parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Matter to remain on the Jury Trial calendar.  Victim is to be placed on-call.  Court addresses the Justice Point Report.  Court admonishes defendant.  No action taken at this time.
Justice Point Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  (no action taken)  rmm

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Counsel informed Court there has been a breakdown in communication.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Court advised defendant this will be the last public defender appointed.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
from the defense received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State is ready to proceed.  Defense counsel indicated he is not prepared as he has not been able to meet with his client.  Court granted request for adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 10/14/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed office contact) received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant appeared at 11:00.  Court ordered the warrant withdrawn.  Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for pretrial conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs Court he has not received all discovery and requests further pre-trial conference.
Court advises the defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order and orders case adjourned for further pre-trial conference in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated August 3, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ARACELIS A. AND HER CHILDREN.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Erik M Ayala in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Erik M Ayala in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
